{"step_by_step_thinking": "The TNM classification is a globally recognized standard for classifying the extent of spread of cancer. The 7th edition of the TNM classification provides a detailed description of the anatomical extent of the tumor. However, it does not include any information about biological predictors or molecular markers, which are increasingly recognized as important in determining prognosis and guiding treatment in many types of cancer, including early gastric cancer.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
